# 8. Introduction to FaceNet, OpenFace and DeepFace
----
## Face Recognition: Popular CNN Models

- VGGFace: A set of face recognition models by members of the Visual Geometry Group (VGG) at eh University of Oxford.
  - VGGFace (2015), VGGFace2 (2017)
</br>
- FaceNet: Face recognition system developed by Google
  - Paper: FaceNet - A Unified Embedding for Face Recognition and Clustering (2015)
</br>
- OpenFace: Free and open source face recognition with deep neural networks.

    - By Brandon Amos et.al
    - OpenFace (2016), OpenFace 2.0 (2018)
</br>
- DeepFace: Face recognition system developed by Facebook(meta)
  - Paper: DeepFace: Closing the Gap to Human-level Performance in Face Verification (2014) by Yaniv Taigman et al.

## VGG Face Model
- VGG-Face model is the same NeuralNet architecture as teh VGG16 model.
  - (VGG16 was used to identify 1000 classes of object in the ImageNet competition)

1. VGGFace model (2015 Paper by Omkar Parkhi).
2. VGGFace2 model (2017 Paper by Qiong Cao).
   - The dataset contains 3.31 milion images of 9131 subjects (362.6 per subject)

## OpenFace Model
- OpenFace: Free and open source face recognition with deep neural networks.
  - By Brandon Amos et.al
  - OpenFace (2016), OpenFace 2.0 (2018)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## DeepFace (By Meta) Model
- DeepFace: Face recognition system developed by Facebook
  - Paper: DeepFace: Closing the Gap to Human-Level Performance in Face Verification (2014) by Yaniv Taigman et al. 

## FaceNet: Face recognition system developed by Google (2015).
- Paper: FaceNet - A Unified Embedding for Face Recognition and Clustering
- (Florian Schroff, Dmitry Kalenichenko, James Philbin)
- FaceNet gives comparatively better recogniton than all other 3 models.
